Class SVGTransform.SVGRotate

java.lang.Object
org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.ValueBase
org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGTransform
org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGTransform.SVGRotate
Enclosing class:
SVGTransform
@ClassVersion(sourceVersion="$Id: SVGTransform.java 1074 2023-10-02 12:05:06Z tquadrat $") @API(status=STABLE, since="0.0.5") public static final class SVGTransform.SVGRotate extends SVGTransform
The SVG rotate transformation.

This transformation definition specifies a rotation by a degrees about a given point. If the optional parameters x and y are not supplied, the rotation is about the origin of the current user coordinate system. The operation corresponds to the matrix 
    cos a  -sin a  0
  ( sin a   cos a  0 )
      0       0    1
If the optional parameters x and y are supplied, the rotation is about the point (x,y). Then the operation represents the equivalent of the following transform definition list:
  1. translate( x, y )
  2. rotate( a )
  3. translate( -x, -y )
Author:
Thomas Thrien (thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org)
Version:
$Id: SVGTransform.java 1074 2023-10-02 12:05:06Z tquadrat $
Since:
0.0.5
